text: Mammillaria herrerae is a species of plant in the family Cactaceae. It is endemic to Mexico where it is confined to Querétaro. Its habitat is semi- desert shrubland. It is threatened by habitat loss and illegal collection. In a 20-year period over 95% of the species population was illegally collected or sold. Mammillaria herrerae has an IUCN rating of critically endangered. Mammillaria herreae v. albiflora, from San Luis de la Paz, Guanajuato. ==References== herrerae Category:Cacti of Mexico Category:Endemic flora of Mexico Category:Flora of Querétaro Category:Taxonomy articles created by Polbot
title: Mammillaria herrerae
